data.title: The Electronic Intifada
data.text:
Sweden investigating Israeli death threats against its foreign minister

Ali Abunimah

As Israeli leaders turn their fire on Margot Wallström, an article comparing her to UN diplomat assassinated by a Zionist militia is raising concern. Read more about Sweden investigating Israeli death threats against its foreign minister

How Israel honors the murderers in its midst

Stanley Heller

Benjamin Netanyahu was wrong to claim that Israel has no public squares named after killers of civilians. Read more about How Israel honors the murderers in its midst

BBC hands airwaves over to Israel's minister for war

Amena Saleem

A recent BBC Radio 4 interview with Moshe Yaalon marks a new low in the public broadcaster’s already-terrible coverage of Palestine. Read more about BBC hands airwaves over to Israel's minister for war

NY Times rewrites peace process history to make it more “balanced”

Ali Abunimah

The New York Times rewrites history of a famous incident to claim US Secretary of State James Baker publicly rebuked Israelis and Palestinians, when in fact his rebuke was only aimed at Israel. Read more about NY Times rewrites peace process history to make it more “balanced”

"Bone-breaker" Rabin lauded in new book by veteran lobbyist

David Cronin

Former American Jewish Congress chief Robert Lifton tries to put a human face on some of Israel’s most notorious war criminals. Read more about "Bone-breaker" Rabin lauded in new book by veteran lobbyist
